content:
I’m a Ph.D. student in Bioengineering at UC Berkeley. Before I moved to Berkeley, I spent six years at UCLA and obtained B.S. in Computer Science and Applied Mathematics with Cum Laude and M.S. in Computer Science.
My past research was on computer vision and medical imaging. In college, I worked on knowledge graph parsing/explainable AI advised by Prof. Song-Chun Zhu. During M.S., I worked on MRI post-analysis advised by Prof. Kyung Hyun Sung and co-advised by Prof. Fabien Scalzo. My conference paper of prostate imaging AI diagnosis received Best Paper 2nd place in IEEE/EMBS ISBI 2019.
Besides research, I spend time on casual downhill skiing, jogging, trekking, photography. I’m originally from Beijing, China, and my name is pronounced as “Rei-Ming Tsao/Chao” :p

title: Ruiming Cao
